div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1103 Feodosiia (anc. Theodosia), Crimea (412) oblast, Ukraine, 1901 Burial: 3rd cent. B.C.? Contents: 396 AE Panticapaeum: AE (as BMC 24?) Disposition: museum material lost during war † DAK 1901, no. 158 Bulletin International de Numismatique 1 (1902), p. 43, no. 18 † OAK 1901 (publ. 1903), pp. 135, 171 The sources cited by Noe give an obviously exaggerated number of coins in the hoard
